com.hazelcast.internal.metrics

Annotation Type Probe


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
public @interface Probe
    Annotation that can be placed on a field or a method of an object to indicate that it should be tracked by the MetricsRegistry when the MetricsRegistry.scanAndRegister(Object, String) is called.

    The MetricsRegistry will automatically scan all interfaces and super classes of an object (recursively). So it is possible to define a Probe on e.g. an interface or an abstract class.

    Prefer field

    Prefer placing the Probe to a field rather than to a method if the type is primitive. The Field provides access to the actual field without the need for autoboxing. With the Method a wrapper object is created when a primitive is returned by the method. Therefore, fields produce less garbage than methods.

    A Probe can be placed on fields or methods with the following (return) type:

    1. byte
    2. short
    3. int
    4. float
    5. long
    6. double
    7. AtomicInteger
    8. AtomicLong
    9. Counter
    10. Byte
    11. Short
    12. Integer
    13. Float
    14. Double
    15. Collection: it will return the size
    16. Map: it will return the size
    17. Semaphore: it will return the number of available permits
    If the field or method points to a null reference, it is interpreted as 0.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      ProbeLevel level
      Returns the ProbeLevel.
      String name
      The name of the Probe.
      ProbeUnit unit
      Measurement unit of a Probe.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract String name
        The name of the Probe. By default the name of the field or method is used.
        Returns:
        the name of the Probe.
        Default:
        ""

      • level

        public abstract ProbeLevel level
        Returns the ProbeLevel. Using ProbeLevel one can indicate how 'important' this Probe is. This is useful to reduce memory overhead due to tracking of probes.
        Returns:
        the ProbeLevel.
        Default:
        com.hazelcast.internal.metrics.ProbeLevel.INFO

      • unit

        public abstract ProbeUnit unit
        Measurement unit of a Probe. Not used on member, becomes a part of the key.
        Default:
        com.hazelcast.internal.metrics.ProbeUnit.COUNT
